definitions: Marked out or secured with stakes.
Supported or held up with a stake or stakes.
Bet or risked money or something valuable on the outcome of an event.
Claimed or reserved a share or interest in something.
Pierced or killed with a stake.
examples: They staked out the perimeter of the new property.
The gardener staked the young tree to protect it from the wind.
He staked all his savings on the horse race.
She staked her claim to the last piece of pie.
The vampire was staked through the heart.
